conclusion: Use the relationship between voltage and current in an ideal transformer.
Identify given values: ammeter reads 1.4 A, voltmeter reads 10 V, resistances are 50 Ω.
Use formula for voltage ratio in an ideal transformer.
Voltage V1 on primary side is 1.4 × n1.
Voltage V2 on secondary side is 10 V.
Using voltage ratio: (1.4 × n1) / 10 = n1 / n2.
Solve for n1 and n2: 1.4 × n1 = 10 × n2, n1 = 10 × n2.
Substitute n1 = 10n2 into voltage ratio equation: 1.4 × 10 = 1, n2 = 10.
The turns ratio of the primary and secondary coils of the transformer is 10:1.
